snippet: Beijing’s leaders signal a readiness for some personal freedoms and further economic reforms, all under firm one-party rule.
abstract: Editorial welcomes China's announcement that it will relax its draconian one-child policy and end its brutal 're-education through labor' camps; notes Chinese leaders were vague about when and how they will carry out these reforms; contends initiatives outlined during the Central Committee conference could significantly improve the lives of Chinese people.
